DOC.brief_summary: The study aim evaluate whether do-it-yourself device self-measuring health parameter subject use obtain useful data scientific study . Besides , study aim evaluate increase awareness health status self-monitoring health parameter also serve motivational instrument change health behaviour .
DOC.brief_title: The Potential Do-it-yourself Devices Obtaining Personal Health Data
DOC.detailed_description: During three month study subject self-monitor multiple parameter health do-it-yourself device . Subjects supply device measure physical activity , food intake , body weight , blood pressure , blood glucose level blood cholesterol level . These device use vary frequency , range continuously baseline- endpoint measure . Subjects upload data result self-measures encode account online portal . At time study , subject log-on portal , gain insight health parameter . Only encode subject data export portal data analysis .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age range 18 67 year 2 . Deskjob exceed Dutch Standard Healthy Physical Activity 5 hours/week 3 . Healthy assess Health Lifestyle questionnaire 4 . Body mass index : 20 30 kg/m2 5 . Able use selfmonitoring device 6 . Voluntary participation 7 . Having give write informed consent 8 . Willing comply study procedures 9 . Willingness share pseudonymised data food intake external party Fatsecret ( food intake app provider ) 10 . Willingness share pseudonymised data blood glucose , blood pressure , physical activity body weight external party Medisana ( provider measurement Toolkit ) 11 . Willingness share pseudonymised data food intake , blood glucose , blood cholesterol , blood pressure , physical activity body weight Nutrition Research Cohort ( NRC ) database 12 . Willing accept use nameless data , include publication , confidential use storage data TNO 13 . Have desktop laptop internet access home 14 . Subjects Smartphone Bluetooth run either recent version iOS Android . 15 . Having one TNO location Delft , Den Haag Rijswijk post 1 . Use concomitant medication include medication know effect blood glucose , cholesterol insulin 2 . Having history medical surgical event may significantly affect study outcome , include physical limitation cardiovascular event 3 . Having pacemaker 4 . Currently suffer diabetes type I type II determine general practitioner 5 . Reported slimming medically prescribe diet 6 . Physical , mental practical limitation use computerized system 7 . Alcohol consumption > 28 units/week male > 21 unit ( drink ) /week female 8 . Reported unexplained weight loss gain > 2 kg three month prior prestudy screen 9 . Partner first seconddegree relative TNO personnel station TNO location Zeist , Leiden , Hoofddorp Soesterberg study protocol develop .
